Visa_Type_Details: D7 Passive Income / D8 Digital Nomad Visa
Max_Stay_Notes: D7/D8 visa grants 2-year residence permit, renewable. EU citizens: unlimited free movement. Non-EU: visa required after 90 days.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens; EU citizens free movement
Visa_Score: Excellent – best-in-class nomad visa ecosystem
Bureaucracy_Ease_Score: Moderate – improving but SEF queues exist
Premium_Insights: D7 requires passive income €760/mo; D8 requires remote employment proof. NHR tax regime offers 0-20% on foreign income for 10 years. Best coworking: Second Home, Selina, Avila Spaces. WebSummit held annually. Strong startup and freelancer ecosystem. Best for: solo entrepreneurs, lifestyle-first nomads.

Max_Stay_Notes: DNV grants 1-year initial permit, extendable to 3+2 years. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days visa-free in Schengen without DNV.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens with remote employment/freelance proof
Visa_Score: Good – competitive but Beckham Law tax benefit is strong
Premium_Insights: Beckham Law caps income tax at 24% for first 6 years for new residents. Requires working for non-Spanish company. Strong tech and startup scene. Best coworking: MOB, Aticco, Betahaus. High cost of living but lifestyle payoff is exceptional. Best for: tech workers, creatives, beach lovers.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-EU nationals: 90 days Schengen visa-free. Longer stay via Freiberufler or self-employment visa (3-6 month processing). EU citizens: unlimited free movement.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU; requires German client/employer or freelance registration"
Visa_Score: Moderate – no DNV, freelance visa is complex but achievable
Bureaucracy_Ease_Score: Poor – Ausländerbehörde appointments notoriously difficult to get
Premium_Insights: No dedicated DNV. Freiberufler visa best for creatives, journalists, programmers. Requires proof of German clients or employer. Appointment wait times 3-6 months at Ausländerbehörde. High tax burden (up to 45%) but world-class infrastructure. Best for: established freelancers with German clients.

Max_Stay_Notes: Zivno (trade license) visa grants 2-year residence permit, renewable. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days Schengen without Zivno visa.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens; must register as sole trader
Visa_Score: Good – established pathway, EU Schengen access
Premium_Insights: Zivno (trade license) is the go-to for freelancers. Register as sole trader, pay low social/health contributions. Effective tax rate can be as low as 15-20% using lump-sum expense deduction (60% of income). Strong expat and nomad community. Best for: freelancers wanting low-tax EU Schengen base in Central Europe.

Max_Stay_Notes: White Card grants 1 year, renewable once (2 years max). EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days Schengen without White Card.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens working remotely
Visa_Score: Good – low income requirement, flat 15% tax
Premium_Insights: 15% flat personal income tax – one of the lowest in EU. White Card requires €2000/month income. Cannot work for Hungarian clients. Strong ruin bar culture and expat scene. Best coworking: Impact Hub, Loffice. Best for: nomads wanting EU Schengen base with flat low tax and low cost of living.

Max_Stay_Notes: DNV grants 1-year residence permit. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days Schengen visa-free without DNV. e-Residency does not grant physical residency rights.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens working remotely
Visa_Score: Excellent – e-Residency program is globally unique
Bureaucracy_Ease_Score: Excellent – most digital government in Europe
Premium_Insights: e-Residency allows running EU company remotely from anywhere in the world – company registration in 15 minutes online. DNV grants physical residency. 0% corporate tax on reinvested profits. 20% distribution tax only when profits withdrawn. World's most advanced digital government. Best for: entrepreneurs wanting EU company, digital-first nomads.

Max_Stay_Notes: DNV grants 1-year initial permit, extendable to 3+2 years. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days visa-free without DNV.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens with remote employment/freelance proof
Visa_Score: Good – underrated Spanish DNV city
Premium_Insights: Same Startups Law and Beckham Law as other Spanish cities. Lower cost of living and less bureaucratic backlog than Madrid/Barcelona. Excellent beach-city balance. Best coworking: Las Naves, Espai Open. Best for: families, beach-lifestyle nomads on a budget.

Visa_Type_Details: D7 Passive Income / D8 Digital Nomad Visa
Max_Stay_Notes: D7/D8 visa grants 2-year residence permit, renewable. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: visa required after 90 days Schengen allowance.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens; EU citizens free movement
Visa_Score: Excellent – same framework as Lisbon, less crowded
Premium_Insights: Same D7/D8 and NHR framework as Lisbon. Significantly more affordable and less crowded. Growing nomad scene. Best coworking: Porto i/o, BDMI, Coworklisboa Porto. Best for: budget-conscious nomads who want Portugal lifestyle without Lisbon prices.

Max_Stay_Notes: DNV grants 1 year, renewable once for a 2nd year only (max 2 years total on DNV). EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days Schengen visa-free without DNV.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens working remotely for non-Greek employers
Visa_Score: Good – 50% income tax reduction is strong incentive
Premium_Insights: 50% income tax exemption for first 7 years for new tax residents. Requires staying 183+ days/year. Flat tax alternative: €100k/year for non-dom status. Best coworking: Synergy, The Cube Athens. Best for: high earners wanting Mediterranean lifestyle with serious tax savings.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-EU nationals: 90 days Schengen visa-free. Longer stay via residence/business permit. EU citizens: unlimited.
Visa_Eligibility: EU free movement; non-EU via residence/business"
Visa_Score: Moderate – lower cost than Warsaw, same visa framework
Premium_Insights: Same Polish business framework as Warsaw. Significantly cheaper. Strong student and expat energy. Large English-speaking community. Best for: EU nomads wanting affordable Central European base.

Max_Stay_Notes: Croatian DNV grants 1 year. Cannot be immediately renewed – must exit Croatia for 6 months before reapplying. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days Schengen without DNV.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens working remotely for non-Croatian employers/clients
Visa_Score: Good – straightforward process, scenic lifestyle
Premium_Insights: Tax exemption on income while on Croatian DNV – pay no Croatian income tax. One of the fastest-processing DNVs in Europe (2 weeks). Cannot be renewed – must exit for 6 months before reapplying. Best for: nomads wanting EU Schengen base with zero income tax for a year.

Max_Stay_Notes: D Visa for freelancers grants 1-year residence, renewable. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days visa-free (Bulgaria has separate allowance from Schengen, now joining).
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens with freelance/remote income
Visa_Score: Good – 10% flat tax is exceptional value
Premium_Insights: 10% flat income tax – one of EU's lowest. 10% corporate tax. D visa for freelancers with relatively low income threshold. EU member but not Schengen (joining in progress). Very low cost of living. Best coworking: Campus X, Betahaus Sofia. Best for: tax-efficiency seekers, budget nomads wanting EU base.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days visa-free then Long-Stay D visa required. Romania is EU but not yet fully Schengen – separate 90-day allowance from Schengen.
Visa_Eligibility: EU free movement; non-EU via long-stay D visa"
Visa_Score: Moderate – EU member but no DNV yet
Premium_Insights: 10% flat income tax and micro-enterprise tax of 1-3% of revenue – very tax competitive. EU member but not yet Schengen (joining in progress). Strong IT sector. Low cost base. Best for: EU citizens wanting ultra-low tax EU base, tech workers.

Max_Stay_Notes: Most nationalities (EU, US, UK, etc.) genuinely visa-free for 365 days – no visa required. Longer stay via residence permit. Non-EU, non-Schengen country.
Visa_Eligibility: Most nationalities visa-free for 1 year
Visa_Score: Excellent – 1 year visa-free + 1% tax on foreign income
Bureaucracy_Ease_Score: Excellent – extremely easy to set up
Premium_Insights: Unique 1% tax on foreign-sourced income remitted from abroad via Virtual Zone or individual entrepreneur status. Most nationalities can stay 1 year visa-free without registration. Extremely easy to open bank account and register business. Fast-growing nomad scene. Best for: budget nomads, tax-minimization seekers, those wanting non-EU flexibility.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. EU and many non-EU nationals visa-free 90 days. Longer stay via Temporary Residence Permit. Non-Schengen, non-EU – Schengen 90-day rule does not reset here.
Visa_Eligibility: EU citizens visa-free 90 days; others vary
Visa_Score: Moderate – no DNV but Serbia is a nomad favourite
Premium_Insights: 10% flat income and corporate tax – one of Europe's lowest. No DNV but visa-free for many nationalities for 90 days. Temporary residence obtainable by renting. Growing tech outsourcing scene. Extremely low cost of living. Best for: budget nomads, Balkan lifestyle seekers, tax-efficient freelancers.

Visa_Type_Details: Temporary Residence Permit for Remote Workers
Max_Stay_Notes: Temporary Residence Permit for remote workers grants 1-2 years. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days Schengen without permit.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens working remotely
Visa_Score: Good – fast-growing startup ecosystem
Premium_Insights: Lithuania's startup visa ecosystem is booming post-Brexit as fintech companies relocated from London. 15% flat income tax. Strong fintech and blockchain scene. Government actively promoting tech talent attraction. Best for: fintech/blockchain workers, EU-seeking nomads.

Max_Stay_Notes: Self-employment residence permit grants 1-5 years. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days Schengen visa-free without permit. Shown as 365 (1-year initial grant).
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU via self-employment or company formation
Visa_Score: Moderate – no DNV but affordable EU Schengen
Premium_Insights: No dedicated DNV. Self-employment residence available. 20% flat income tax. 0% tax on reinvested corporate profits. Declining population trend – government actively welcoming skilled foreigners. Best for: EU-seeking nomads wanting Baltic base at lower cost than Tallinn.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-EU nationals: 90 days Schengen visa-free. ZZP self-employment available for EU citizens without sponsor. Non-EU needs HSM with employer. EU citizens: unlimited.
Visa_Eligibility: EU free movement; non-EU via HSM or ZZP
Visa_Score: Moderate – 30% ruling attractive but employer required
Premium_Insights: 30% ruling: 30% of salary tax-free for 5 years (requires employer sponsor). ZZP self-employment for EU citizens – straightforward to register. No DNV. High income tax (49.5% top rate) offset by 30% ruling. Best for: employed tech workers with Dutch company offer.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-EU nationals: 90 days Schengen visa-free. Longer stay requires employer-sponsored work permit. EU citizens: unlimited.
Visa_Eligibility: EU free movement; non-EU via sponsored work permit"
Visa_Score: Poor – no DNV, very high tax burden
Bureaucracy_Ease_Score: Good – digital but requires employer sponsor
Premium_Insights: No DNV. Researcher/specialist visas available but require employer sponsor. Income tax 55%+. Best for EU citizens enjoying world-class quality of life if cost is not primary concern. Not recommended for independent nomads/freelancers.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-EU nationals: 90 days Schengen visa-free. Self-employment permit available but requires proven business activity. EU citizens: unlimited.
Visa_Eligibility: EU free movement; non-EU requires employer or self-employment"
Visa_Score: Poor – no DNV, tax 50%+
Premium_Insights: No DNV. Self-employment permit requires proven business activity. High tax (50%+). Best for EU citizens or those with Swedish employer. Not cost-effective for most nomads but quality of life is exceptional. Best for: established professionals with Swedish connections.

Visa_Type_Details: Skilled Worker Visa / Global Talent Visa
Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-Schengen, non-EU (post-Brexit UK). Non-EU including EU nationals: 6 months visa-free as visitor. Longer stay requires Skilled Worker visa with employer sponsor. Note: EU citizens no longer have free movement in UK.
Visa_Eligibility: Requires UK employer sponsor or Global Talent endorsement
Visa_Score: Poor for independent nomads – post-Brexit visa complexity
Premium_Insights: Post-Brexit, non-EU UK visas require employer sponsor (Skilled Worker) or endorsement body (Global Talent). No DNV. UK income tax up to 45%. Non-Schengen Non-EU. Best for: employed workers with UK employer, Global Talent endorsed individuals in tech/arts/research.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-Schengen EU – separate 90-day allowance from Schengen. Non-EU: 90 days visa-free for many nationalities. Longer stay via Critical Skills or employer sponsorship. EU citizens: unlimited.
Visa_Eligibility: EU free movement; non-EU via Critical Skills or employer"
Visa_Score: Poor for nomads – no DNV, housing crisis is severe
Premium_Insights: No DNV. Irish holding company structure attractive for international businesses (12.5% corporate tax). Non-Schengen EU – different travel rules. Severe housing shortage keeps costs very high. Best for: employed workers with Irish tech company offer, business owners using Irish corporate structure.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-EU nationals: 90 days Schengen visa-free. Longer stay via Freiberufler/self-employment visa. EU citizens: unlimited free movement.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU via Freiberufler or self-employment; EU free movement"
Visa_Score: Moderate – same as Berlin framework, easier than Berlin bureaucracy
Premium_Insights: Same Freiberufler visa as Berlin but Bavarian administration generally more efficient. High cost but world-class engineering/tech ecosystem. Trade fair capital. Best for: tech professionals with German clients or employer.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-EU nationals: 90 days Schengen visa-free. Longer stay via Red-White-Red Card (self-employed) – 2 years renewable. EU citizens: unlimited.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU via RWR Card; EU free movement
Visa_Score: Moderate – no DNV but RWR card available for self-employed
Premium_Insights: Red-White-Red Card for self-employed requires business plan and income projection. 55% top income tax but effective rate lower with deductions. Exceptional quality of life consistently ranked #1 globally. Best for: established professionals, quality-of-life prioritizers.

Max_Stay_Notes: Nomad Residence Permit grants 1 year, renewable. Non-Schengen EU – different travel rules apply. EU citizens: unlimited residency rights.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens working remotely
Visa_Score: Good – English-speaking EU country advantage
Premium_Insights: Only English-speaking EU country with dedicated DNV. 15% flat tax on foreign income remitted to Malta under Global Residence Programme. Non-Schengen but EU member – different travel rules apply. Best coworking: Regus Malta, The Spot. Best for: English-first nomads, those wanting EU base with favorable tax.

Max_Stay_Notes: DNV grants 1-year initial permit, extendable to 3+2 years. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days visa-free without DNV.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens with remote employment/freelance proof
Visa_Score: Good – rising nomad hub with strong DNV adoption
Premium_Insights: Fastest-growing nomad city in Spain. Google campus opened 2023. Beckham Law applies. Strong tech community forming. Best coworking: La Térmica, Citek. Best for: tech workers, sun-seekers, those wanting affordable Spain with fast growth.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-EU nationals: 90 days Schengen visa-free. Longer stay via Talent Passport (4 years) or auto-entrepreneur registration. EU citizens: unlimited.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU via Talent Passport; EU free movement"
Visa_Score: Moderate – French admin complex but Talent Passport is strong
Bureaucracy_Ease_Score: Poor – French bureaucracy is notoriously slow
Premium_Insights: French Talent Passport (Passeport Talent) valid 4 years for skilled workers. Profession libérale status for freelancers (auto-entrepreneur). Income tax up to 45% but social charges moderate for auto-entrepreneur. Monaco proximity for ultra-wealthy (20min away, 0% income tax). Best for: EU citizens, high-earners considering Monaco base.

Max_Stay_Notes: No dedicated DNV. EU citizens visa-free 90 days. Non-EU varies by nationality. Longer stay via Temporary Residence Permit – complex process. Non-EU, non-Schengen.
Visa_Eligibility: EU citizens visa-free; non-EU varies by nationality
Visa_Score: Low – no dedicated nomad framework yet
Premium_Insights: No DNV. Extremely low cost of living compensates. 10% flat income tax and 10% corporate tax – very competitive. EU candidate country. Bureaucracy is complex but doable with local help. Best for: ultra-budget nomads, adventure seekers, those testing the Balkans.

Max_Stay_Notes: No dedicated DNV. Most nationalities (EU, US, UK etc.) visa-free for 90 days. Longer stay via Type D residence permit requires application in-country. Non-EU/Schengen country.
Visa_Eligibility: Most nationalities visa-free for 90 days; longer stay via residence
Visa_Score: Moderate – no formal DNV but very accessible
Premium_Insights: No formal DNV but most nationalities can stay visa-free for 90 days without registration. Flat 15% income tax. 15% corporate tax. Very low cost base. EU candidate country. Best for: ultra-budget nomads, those comfortable outside EU framework.

Max_Stay_Notes: Zivno visa grants 2-year residence permit, renewable. Same framework as Prague. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days Schengen without visa.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU; must register as sole trader in Czech Republic
Visa_Score: Good – same as Prague, much cheaper city
Premium_Insights: Same Zivno framework as Prague with much lower cost of living. University city feel. Growing tech ecosystem. Best for: nomads wanting Prague-framework benefits at lower price point.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-EU nationals: 90 days Schengen visa-free. Longer stay via residence permit. EU citizens: unlimited.
Visa_Eligibility: EU free movement; non-EU via residence/business
Visa_Score: Moderate
Premium_Insights: Coastal Polish city with lower cost than Warsaw. Same business visa framework. Amber Road history and Baltic Sea lifestyle. Best for: EU nomads wanting coastal Polish lifestyle.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-EU nationals: 90 days Schengen visa-free. Longer stay via self-employment temporary residence (1-2 years). EU citizens: unlimited.
Visa_Eligibility: EU free movement; non-EU via self-employment residence"
Visa_Score: Moderate – no DNV but stable EU Schengen
Premium_Insights: No dedicated DNV. Self-employment residence requires demonstrable income. 19% flat income tax for sole traders. Slovenia has excellent work-life balance scores. Best for: quality-of-life-first nomads wanting small, clean, safe EU city.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days then Long-Stay D visa. Romania has separate entry allowance from Schengen zone.
Visa_Eligibility: EU free movement; non-EU via long-stay D visa"
Visa_Score: Moderate – Romania's tech hub, same framework as Bucharest
Premium_Insights: Same Romanian tax advantages as Bucharest (10% flat / 1-3% micro-enterprise). Cluj is Romania's fastest-growing tech city. Strong expat community. Best for: tech workers, startup founders wanting low-cost EU base.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-EU nationals: 90 days Schengen visa-free. Longer stay via residence permit. EU citizens: unlimited.
Visa_Eligibility: EU free movement; non-EU via residence/business"
Visa_Score: Moderate – underrated Polish city
Premium_Insights: Same Polish business framework. Lower cost than Warsaw/Krakow. Growing tech scene. High quality of life for price. Best for: EU nomads wanting affordable, less-touristy Polish city.

Max_Stay_Notes: DNV grants 1-year initial permit, extendable to 3+2 years. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days visa-free without DNV.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens with remote employment/freelance proof
Visa_Score: Good
Premium_Insights: Beckham Law applies. Intense summer heat (40°C+) a key consideration. Rich cultural scene. Growing startup ecosystem. Best coworking: Coco Sevilla, Espacio Open. Best for: culture enthusiasts, Andalusia lifestyle seekers.

Max_Stay_Notes: DNV grants 1-year initial permit, extendable to 3+2 years. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days visa-free without DNV.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens with remote employment/freelance proof
Visa_Score: Good – cheapest DNV-eligible Spanish city
Premium_Insights: Most affordable of the Spanish DNV cities. University city with young energy. Alhambra culture. Beckham Law applies. Small but growing nomad community. Best for: budget nomads, culture seekers, those wanting authentic Spain.

Max_Stay_Notes: Same Greek DNV as Athens: 1 year, renewable once (2 years max). EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days Schengen without DNV.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens working remotely for non-Greek employers
Visa_Score: Good – same as Athens framework but less competition
Premium_Insights: Same 50% tax exemption as Athens. Much cheaper city. Smaller nomad community but growing. University city energy. Best for: budget nomads wanting Greek DNV benefits without Athens cost.

Max_Stay_Notes: No dedicated DNV. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days then D Visa or residence permit required. Bulgaria separate Schengen allowance.
Visa_Eligibility: EU free movement; non-EU via D visa"
Visa_Score: Moderate – same tax as Sofia, half the infrastructure
Premium_Insights: Same 10% Bulgarian flat tax. Much smaller and cheaper than Sofia. 2019 European Capital of Culture – strong arts scene. Best for: budget nomads wanting ultra-quiet EU base with low tax.

Max_Stay_Notes: D7/D8 visa grants 2-year residence permit, renewable. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: visa required after 90 Schengen days.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens; EU citizens free movement
Visa_Score: Good – same as mainland Portugal, quieter application process
Premium_Insights: NHR regime applies same as mainland. Madeira Digital Nomad Village in Ponta do Sol offers community infrastructure. Smaller but tight-knit nomad scene. Best for: nature lovers, remote workers wanting island life with EU stability.

Max_Stay_Notes: DNV grants 1-year initial permit, extendable to 3+2 years. EU citizens: unlimited. Canary Islands are Schengen zone.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens with remote employment/freelance proof
Visa_Score: Excellent – year-round spring climate is unique advantage
Premium_Insights: Unique 22°C year-round climate. Canary Islands ZEC tax zone offers 4% corporate tax for registered companies – significant for freelancers who incorporate. Strong surf and outdoor nomad community. Best coworking: Coworking Las Palmas, The Office. Best for: outdoor-lifestyle nomads, surfers, tax-savvy freelancers.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days then Long-Stay D visa. Romania separate from Schengen allowance.
Visa_Eligibility: EU free movement; non-EU via long-stay D visa"
Visa_Score: Low-Moderate – Romania's western gateway city
Premium_Insights: Same Romanian tax framework. Westernmost Romanian city, close to Hungary and Serbia borders. 2023 European Capital of Culture. Smaller nomad community but growing. Best for: nomads wanting ultra-affordable EU base off the beaten path.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-EU nationals: 90 days Schengen visa-free. Longer stay via self-employment residence permit (1-3 years). EU citizens: unlimited.
Visa_Eligibility: EU free movement; non-EU via residence permit
Visa_Score: Moderate – proximity to Vienna is unique advantage
Premium_Insights: No dedicated DNV. Self-employment permit available. 21% flat income tax. Low social contributions option. 1 hour from Vienna by train – access to two cities. EU Schengen. Best for: EU nomads wanting low-cost Central European base with Austrian proximity.

Max_Stay_Notes: DNV grants 1 year, renewable once (2 years max). Non-Schengen EU. EU citizens: unlimited. Non-EU: 90 days visa-free without DNV.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU citizens working remotely for non-Cypriot employers
Visa_Score: Good – 0% on dividends and capital gains
Premium_Insights: 12.5% corporate tax – lowest in EU. 0% tax on dividends and capital gains. Non-dom status available. English widely spoken. Non-Schengen EU. Best for: entrepreneurs, investors, those structuring companies with tax efficiency in mind.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-EU nationals: 90 days Schengen visa-free. ZZP for EU citizens. Non-EU needs employer for HSM permit. EU citizens: unlimited.
Visa_Eligibility: EU free movement; non-EU via HSM or self-employment"
Visa_Score: Moderate – 30% ruling is attractive for high earners
Premium_Insights: Netherlands 30% ruling exempts 30% of salary from tax for first 5 years for incoming workers. Requires employer sponsor. Self-employment via ZZP (sole trader) available for EU citizens. Smaller and cheaper than Amsterdam. Best for: employed nomads with Dutch employer, EU citizens.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-EU nationals: 90 days Schengen visa-free. Red-White-Red Card same as Vienna. EU citizens: unlimited.
Visa_Eligibility: Non-EU via RWR Card; EU free movement
Visa_Score: Moderate – same Austrian framework, Alpine lifestyle premium
Premium_Insights: Same Austrian RWR Card framework as Vienna. Smaller admin backlog. World-class ski and outdoor lifestyle. University city. Best for: outdoor-lifestyle nomads wanting Austrian stability, smaller city feel.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-Schengen EU. Non-EU: 90 days visa-free for many nationalities. Longer stay via employer-sponsored permit. EU citizens: unlimited.
Visa_Eligibility: EU free movement; non-EU via Critical Skills"
Visa_Score: Poor for nomads – same as Dublin framework, smaller city
Premium_Insights: Same framework as Dublin at lower cost. 12.5% Irish corporate tax applies. Smaller expat nomad community. Best for: EU citizens wanting Irish lifestyle at lower cost than Dublin.

Max_Stay_Notes: No DNV. Non-EU nationals: 90 days Schengen visa-free. Work permit requires Danish employer sponsor. EU citizens: unlimited.
Visa_Eligibility: EU free movement; non-EU via sponsored work
Visa_Score: Poor – same Danish restrictions as Copenhagen but cheaper city
Premium_Insights: Same visa/tax framework as Copenhagen at lower cost. Second city of Denmark. University city feel. Not nomad-friendly from visa/tax perspective but great for EU citizens prioritizing lifestyle.
